noun.description: A person or group of people standing outside a place of work or other venue, protesting something or trying to persuade others not to enter during a strike.
A soldier or party of soldiers performing a particular duty.
examples: a picket of soldiers fired a volley over the coffin

noun.description: A pointed wooden stake driven into the ground, typically to form a fence or palisade or to tether a horse.

verb.description: Act as a picket outside (a workplace or other venue)
examples: strikers picketed the newspaper's main building

origin: Late 17th century (denoting a pointed stake, on which a soldier was required to stand on one foot as a military punishment): from French piquet pointed stake, from piquer to prick, from pic pike.
